intro: Jasonia candicans, commonly known as the candleflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, showy yellow flowers that resemble candles, hence its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Jasonia candicans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
